reference.title: List of unmanned moon landings
reference.shortdesc: Since the last manned moon landing in 1972, countries have used unmanned space craft to explore landing sites for future manned landings and to search for natural resources.

li.p: Luna Program (Soviet Union): The Luna series included several missions, with Luna 2 being the first spacecraft to reach the Moon in 1959, and Luna 9 achieving the first soft landing in 1966.
Surveyor Program (USA): The Surveyor missions, conducted by NASA from 1966 to 1968, included seven missions that successfully soft-landed on the Moon, providing valuable data for the Apollo program.
Chandrayaan-1 (India): Launched in 2008, this mission was India's first lunar probe and successfully orbited the Moon, conducting a variety of scientific observations.

Chang'e Program (China): China's Chang'e program includes several missions, with Chang'e 3 (2013) achieving a soft landing and deploying a rover, and Chang'e 4 (2019) being the first to land on the far side of the Moon.
Recent Missions: Other recent missions include the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter (2009), which has been mapping the Moon from orbit, and others by various countries.

note.p: This content was sourced from GenAI.
